events.name: Female Technopreneur: One Woman’s Journey and Why We Need More
events.description:
Tech is still largely a man’s world and entrepreneurship even more so. But more and more women today are starting to play a part in the innovation economy and women who swim against the tide to become technopreneurs are changing the world by inspiring others to do the same.

Rekha Pai is a Silicon Valley venture capitalist and an active angel/seed stage investor who has funded for profit and non-profit tech start-ups. She will share her personal journey from engineering into entrepreneurship. Ms Pai will make a case for why young girls should consider STEM careers.

Wine sponor: http://www.thefrenchcellar.sg/

events.name: DevRel Meetup in Singapore #3
events.description: This is our third meetup! We will report about DevRelCon Tokyo 2017 and Beijing 2017.  We'll find out the venue soon. Or if you have any idea of venue (Free is best!), please comment below. • 18:30 Door open  • 19:00 Welcome join & self introducing  • 19:20 What is DevRel & Global trending @ Atsushi Nakatsugawa  • 20:00 Report of DevRelCon Tokyo 2017 & Beijing@TBD  • 20:45 Discussion  • 21:00 Closing  You will get the knowledge of DevRel and mainally methods. We can share the our knowledge and evidences with you. You can start developer relations marketing in your company and make a good relationship with your developers.

events.name: Deep Learning for Recommender Systems
events.description: In recent years, the Internet industry has shifted more and more towards digital content distribution through online services such as Spotify and Netflix. As the number of items that are available as well as the number of users increases dramatically, it becomes a challenge to meet the specific need of each customer. Although recommender systems have been studied extensively, the problem of news and video recommendation in particular is complicated by the sheer variety of different topics and genres, as well as social and geographic factors that influence user preferences.  We are going broad in topic and looking at some of the tricks of the trade in Deep Learning, TensorFlow and Keras. You can expect to have 2-3 'long format' talks, which discuss tips, short cuts, and tricks for building, training and improving your models. And, as always, we're actively looking for more speakers - both '30 minutes long-form', and lightning talks where we welcome folks to come up and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (if you have slides, then #max=10). The key for the Lightning Talks slot is simply the cool/interesting factor.  It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or and enthusiastic beginner: Given the responses we have had, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with. Please suggest yourself here : https://www.meetup.com/Asia-Big-Data-Meetup/suggestion/
events.location: One Raffles Place,  #14-62 Office Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: Getting Started with Projection Mapping
events.description:
A projector is a useful tool in creating a visually captivating display. Projection mapping takes that one step further by mapping the projected image onto a given surface. Combine that with electronics and you are able to create an immersive and interactive experience for the viewer.

Last year, Leon Lim and Lynus Hee made a interactive table top using projection mapping software, custom motion graphics and electronics. In this talk, they will share how it was made and put together.

You can view a video of the project here
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1NHYFKV5uQ4

Leon Lim will also talk about his latest project which is an interactive wall that is on display at the science center from 5th August to 25th of August.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/getting-started-with-projection-mapping-tickets-36645937987
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191
